Title: Manager, Key Account Management
RoleDescription:
Who We Are
CastleGate Forwarding (CGF) is a rapidly growing full-service Non-Vessel Operating Common Carrier (NVOCC) offering scalable solutions for businesses of all sizes. With a global network and a commitment to excellence, we provide comprehensive services to streamline your shipping process, reduce costs, and enhance customer satisfaction
This role is a suppliers facing role and owns the suppliers relationship with CastleGate Forwarding. 
 
What Youll Do
As a key account manager, you will be primarily responsible for:

Lead a key WGS category of suppliers and partner with category leaders through regular meetings to share logistics insights.
Manage the performance and growth of a set portfolio of suppliers at a vertical and category level
Develop and leverage Account Management tools such as scorecards, dashboards, KPI reports to encourage continued improvement and strengthen partnership
Own the supplier experience and drive improvements to NPS (i.e. supplier satisfaction) across the supplier portfolio through strong operational partnerships
Able to design a sales plan to manage suppliers within the categories, execute it effectively, and deliver results.
Identify opportunities and collaborate with various cross functional teams for internal process improvements based on supplier feedback and bottlenecks
Support operational strategy and innovation to drive business goals for revenue, operational performance, and profitability.
Demonstrates good judgment in taking the right actions to support supplier needs while protecting CGFs interests
Has strong commercial acumen and effective sales pitch skills to promote the full range of CG package products

What Youll Need

Bachelors degree required  and a minimum of 7 years in transportation customer service, account management and/or customer success, operations, logistics or a supply chain environment. 
Significant experience in key account management ideally in the logistics/transportation industry with a strong operational background
Excellent written and verbal communication skills  confident, concise, and ability to influence internal/external partners as well as leadership
Experience in building strong customer relationships and engaging in high-level discussions with management teams
Collaborative self-starter who is able to work in a fast-paced environment with a certain level of ambiguity
Ability to lead through influence and work effectively with people in a cross-functional environment
People management experience preferred, with the ability to lead a team, drive overall performance, and conduct regular coaching sessions.

Title: Manager, Freight Sales
RoleDescription:
Wayfair is seeking a highly motivated and results-oriented Sales Agent to drive the adoption and growth of end to end Integrated Logistics using Castle Gate, including Freight Forwarding, drayage Multichannel and 3PL offerings. In this role, you will be responsible for identifying and engaging with potential customers, articulating the value proposition of our services, closing new business and building the relationship with stakeholders. You will play a critical role in expanding Wayfair's presence in the logistics space and contributing to the success of our CastleGate Fulfillment program.
Responsibilities:

Sales Execution:

Conduct outbound sales efforts to generate new leads and identify potential customers for the entire E2E logistics service, Castle Gate, Multichannel and 3PL services, ocean freight, drayage etc.
Manage a pipeline of prospective customers, from initial contact to deal closure.
Present Wayfair's E2E Logistics service package to enable more Multichannel and 3PL offerings, highlighting competitive advantages such as speed, service levels, and cost-effectiveness.
Work with customers to understand their current logistics challenges and demonstrate how Wayfair's solutions can address their needs.
Negotiate and close contracts for Multichannel and 3PL services.
Drive volume commitments from customers to meet and exceed sales targets.

Supplier Engagement & Support:

Gather and relay supplier feedback on rate cards, service levels, and competitive offerings to internal teams.
Address supplier questions and concerns regarding tracking, packing slips, and other operational aspects.
Collaborate with the CastleGate Product team to identify and resolve supplier-surfaced gaps in the offerings.
Educate customers on the benefits of our "all-in" rates compared to base rates quoted by 3PLs.
Emphasize Wayfair's higher level of shipping service compared to competitive 3PLs.

Market Intelligence:

Stay informed about competitive responses from other major retailers (e.g., Amazon, Walmart) in the fulfillment space.
Collect and vet competitive rate cards to inform pricing strategies and identify sweet spots for Wayfair's offerings.

Internal Collaboration:

Work closely with the Supplier Integration and Management (SIM) team, CastleGate Fulfillment, and other internal stakeholders to align on sales strategies and ensure seamless supplier onboarding.
Utilize Salesforce to track leads and manage the sales process.
Contribute to ongoing refinements of our product offerings and pricing


Qualifications:

Proven sales experience 2-3 years, preferably in logistics, supply chain, or e-commerce.
Team management experience 2-3 years.
Strong understanding of 3rd Party Logistics (3PL) and fulfillment operations.
Excellent communication, presentation, and negotiation skills.
Ability to articulate complex value propositions clearly and concisely.
Demonstrated ability to build and maintain strong relationships with customers.
Results-oriented with a track record of achieving and exceeding sales targets.
Familiarity with Salesforce or similar CRM systems is a plus.
Knowledge of Multichannel/3PL fulfillment processes is highly desirable.

Title: Commercial Analyst - Early Careers (Summer 2025 Start)
RoleDescription:
Summer 2025 Start
Location: Boston, Massachusetts
Additional Details:

This is a Boston based opportunity with a 4 day in office expectation (Monday - Thursday) with 1 day remote (Friday).
At this time, Wayfair will not sponsor applicants for employment authorization for this position for the following work visas: STEM OPT EAD, H-1B, H-1B1, E-3, O-1, J-1, or TN.
The salary range for this position is $80,000 - $84,000 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.

Who We Are: 
Wayfair is continuing to expand our commitment to hiring and supporting talent early in their careers, focusing on filling opportunities with experienced graduates who have 1-3 years of experience.
Wayfairs Commercial organization delivers on Wayfairs promise to help everyone anywhere create their feeling of home through building an unparalleled selection, driving tangible value, and ensuring a seamless customer experience. This team builds strong relationships with suppliers to provide true partnership in helping customers create a space that reflects who they are and what they need. They attract, grow, and retain Wayfairs customer base through innovative marketing strategies. This team curates and refines product collections to enhance and optimize the shopping journey. The Commercial team also offers outstanding support to meet customers where they are through home services, financing options, and direct sales interactions.
 
What Youll Do: As a Commercial Analyst at Wayfair, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to shape strategies that deliver value to our customers and strengthen supplier partnerships. Your responsibilities will involve diving into data, identifying key trends, and using your insights to support decision-making across various areas of the business. Specific duties include:

Data Analysis & Reporting: Work with large datasets to identify trends, perform analyses, and develop reports to drive business decisions across different Commercial functions.
Strategic Execution: Contribute to the development and execution of key initiatives across marketing, pricing, product curation, and competitive analysis that align with Wayfairs growth strategies.
Supplier Partnership Optimization: Partner with suppliers to optimize product offerings, refine selection, and enhance the shopping experience by using data to guide decisions.
Customer Experience Enhancement: Use insights from customer behavior and feedback to continuously refine and enhance the shopping experience across Wayfair platforms.
Problem-Solving: Tackle ambiguous challenges by leveraging your analytical skills to generate actionable solutions that deliver measurable improvements in profitability, customer satisfaction, and operational efficiency.
Technology Utilization: Use advanced analytical tools and techniques (Excel, SQL, R, Python) to build data-driven insights and recommend improvements to business processes and outcomes.

 
What Youll Need: 
Basic Qualifications: 

1-3 years of transferable experience in a corporate environment, including internship and co-op experience.
Experience with Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets, SQL or GBQ, and data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio (Looker, Tableau, or PowerBI)
Authorization to work in the United States without visa sponsorship by Wayfair now or in the future. Visa sponsorship includes the following work visas: STEM OPT EAD, H-1B, H-1B1, E-3, O-1, J-1, or TN.

Preferred Qualifications: 

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field
Familiarity with any programming language (R, Python) is a plus, including motivation to learn and develop the skill-set
Strong consultative skills: ability to work effectively and persuasively with a highly cross- functional group of business partners 
Strong business acumen: ability to understand how various parts of the business interact; can identify and approach problems from a customer or supplier perspective 
Exceptional analytical and quantitative skills: excited about working with and synthesizing big data into actionable insights; comfortable using data software to conduct analyses and synthesize findings 
Exceptional problem-solving and execution skills: ability to make decisions, reprioritize tasks, and draw conclusions in the face of ambiguity 
Excellent written and verbal communication skills 
Proficient with Microsoft Excel
Familiarity with any programming language is a plus, including motivation to learn and develop the skill-set (Google BigQuery/SQL, R, Python)

Possible Team Placements: 

Analyst, Global Credit Card Programs: The Fintech & Loyalty (F&L) organization builds and manages the foundational systems, financial products, and fraud detection and prevention services that provide customers with a secure, seamless, and rewarding payment experience. F&L partners with 30+ organizations worldwide to provide a robust selection of gifting, paying, and financing options, to securely process $12B+ in annual transaction volume, and to detect, prevent, and mitigate fraud.
North America/Europe Retail Tech Analytics: The North America/Europe Retail Tech Analytics Team empowers stakeholders across the Global Supplier Organization, including teams to grow their businesses through data-driven analytics, scalable tools, and streamlined processes.
Global Marketing: The Marketing team drives growth for Wayfair on every major advertising platform, owning the strategy, analytics, and operations for our portfolio of cutting-edge digital and offline marketing channels.
Profit Management: The Profit Management team drives the pricing strategy, execution, and ultimately the gross margin profitability across all Wayfair brands, including Wayfair.com, Canada, Perigold, Specialty Retail Brands and Wayfair Professional.Competitive Intelligence: The Competitive Intelligence team is responsible for gathering data on Wayfairs competitors, and leveraging it to meet business goals by evaluating market share, optimizing our competitor web page crawling, and testing novel ways to seek out new competitor data. Business Trends: The Business Trends team works with Wayfairs most senior leadership and all business functions in identifying, monitoring, and intervening on metric trends which drive revenue and long-term customer lifetime value (CLV). Curation, Brands, & Stores Analytics: The Curation, Brands, & Stores Analytics team is the centralized analytics group covering all brands and channels with the goal of giving our curation teams the tools, reporting, and insights to drive excellent customer outcomes, to put the best items in front of customers, and to merchandise those items perfectly.
Catalog Merchandising: The Catalog Merchandising team at Wayfair plays a crucial role within the broader commercial organization by ensuring Wayfair is an easy, intuitive, and stable place for suppliers to sell their products. Product addition is seamless and each item is well curated (ex. has Imagery, complete and accurate attributes, has reviews, fast shipping, etc.). This curation helps customers discover the item thats right for them, with confidence and satisfaction. As part of this team, you might work on 3 parts of the product lifecycle - Product Addition, Product Curation/Health & Product Presentation.
Global Sales: The Global Sales team at Wayfair is responsible for driving revenue growth across all of Wayfair's marketplaces and channels worldwide. This team develops and executes strategies to attract, engage, and retain customers globally, leveraging a deep understanding of international markets and consumer behavior. They collaborate closely with various internal teams to optimize the customer journey and ensure a seamless shopping experience, ultimately maximizing sales and market share on a global scale.
Promotions: This role provides a distinct opportunity to influence decisions that have significant impact across many major business functions at Wayfair. Promotions Analysts constantly use data to drive profitable top line revenue, while working cross-functionally to affect product selection, merchandising, operations, and marketing initiatives. Our Analysts play a key role in building cutting edge Big Data and leveraging these unique, proprietary, and massive datasets, coupled with a constant flow of experimentation on consumer response, to answer thorny questions that guide our go-to-market strategy.

Title: Software Engineer II, Customer Technology
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bangalore, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
Who We Are:
Wayfair runs the largest custom e-commerce large parcel network in the United States, approximately 1.6 million square meters of logistics space. The nature of the network is inherently a highly variable ecosystem that requires flexible, reliable, and resilient systems to operate efficiently.
We are seeking a highly motivated Backend Software Engineer to join the Ad Signals team. This team is responsible for developing robust platforms and integrations that facilitate critical Marketing, Data Engineering, and Fraud Detection initiatives. Key responsibilities include managing services that transmit user activity data to advertising partners, thereby ensuring precise ad targeting. Additionally, the team oversees services for tracking performance data downloads and marketing campaign information, which are instrumental in enhancing our data science models.
What Youll Do:
Partner with your business stakeholders to provide them with transparency, data, and resources to make informed decisions.
Be a technical leader within and across the teams you work with.
Drive high impact architectural decisions and hands-on development, including inception, design, execution, and delivery following good design and coding practices.
Obsessively focus on production readiness for the team including testing, monitoring, deployment, documentation and proactive troubleshooting.
Identify risks and gaps in technical approaches and propose solutions to meet team and project goals.
Create proposals and action plans to garner support across the organization.
Influence and contribute to the teams strategy and roadmap.
Tenacity for learning - curious, and constantly pushing the boundary of what is possible.
We Are a Match Because You Have:

3-5 years of experience in backend software engineering architecting and implementing robust, distributed web applications
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or equivalent combination of education and experience
Track-record of technical leadership for teams following software development best practices (e.g. SOLID, TDD, GRASP, YAGNI, etc).
Track-record of being a hands-on developer efficiently building technically sound systems.
Experience building platforms and services with core Java and Springboot. PHP UI knowledge is a plus.
Experience with Continuous Integration (CI/CD) practices and tools (Buildkite, Jenkins, etc.).
Experience architecting solutions leveraging distributed infrastructure (e.g. Docker, Kubernetes, etc).
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server, Aerospike, Redis, Bigtable, Big Query.
Experience leveraging monitoring and logging technologies (e.g. DataDog, Elasticsearch, InfluxDB, etc).

Title: Senior Product Manager, Agentic AI
RoleDescription:
An Important Note about Wayfair's In-Office Policy and Salary: 
Please note that this is a hybrid role based in Boston, and will require you to work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays.
The salary range for this position is $161,000 - $172,500 per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will be provided as part of the compensation package.
Who We Are
Wayfair believes everyone should live in a home they love. Through technology and innovation, Wayfair makes it possible for shoppers to quickly and easily find exactly what they want from a selection of more than 15 million items across home furnishings, decor, home improvement, housewares, and more. Suppliers are crucial partners in enabling Wayfairs mission. The Global Supplier Technology team builds end to end solutions for our Suppliers and Sales teams as well as the underlying foundational data platform & Machine Learning capabilities. 
One of Wayfairs 5 pillars for success, and a key strategic differentiator w.r.t competitors, is our tight partnership with Suppliers, Advertisers & Business customers. We believe Agentic solutions can take this partnership, and therefore our business, to the next level. We are looking for a Senior PM who is both a visionary and a master executor to drive 0 to 1 Agentic products to uplevel our relationship with Suppliers, Advertisers & Business Customers. This leader will have a massive impact touching nearly all aspects of operating our massive eCommerce business. Success will take the form of driving core metrics that drive both Wayfairs top line and bottom line including but not limited to making Wayfair more price competitive, improving our speed, reducing return & incident rates, growing our high-margin Ads business and building loyalty with our most valuable Business customers. 
As a PM leader for this space, you will define the long term vision and opportunity for this role as well as the multi cycle roadmap and are responsible for bringing this product to life as well as scaling it. You will drive this product through the three phases of growth: Foundational Automation  Proactive Intelligence  Autonomous Orchestration. You will partner closely with engineering, science and commercial teams to bring your product vision to life. 
What Youll Do

Own the product vision & roadmap for the Sales Agentic Ecosystem across our sales and account management teams focused on Suppliers, Advertisers & Business Customers; sequence work to deliver near-term value while building toward the long term vision of autonomous orchestration.
Own roadmap planning and manage execution with dedicated Engineering, Machine Learning Science, Experience Design, and Data Science teams.
Own key build vs. buy decisions and drive leadership alignments. 
Evolve our strategy as we learn and adjust our business goals, and work cross-functionally to continually improve velocity of insights and experimentation.
Define product requirements in collaboration with cross-functional teams across departments, including Advertising, Supplier Technology, B2B, Pricing, Supplier CRM and other teams..
Partner with the engineering team to drive timely and smooth execution through sprint rituals like grooming, planning and retrospective.
Influence the evolution of Wayfair's strategy for agentic workflows. 

We Are A Match Because You Have

Bachelors Degree with strong academic record (strong preference for technical/ engineering backgrounds)
5+ years of product management experience, including recently demonstrated AI-enabled impact.
Deep familiarity with LLMs (e.g., GPT, Claude, Mistral), prompt engineering, embeddings, and GenAI workflows is essential. This position demands someone who is truly immersed in AI, actively engaging with and leveraging these tools to drive innovation.
Experience with AI evaluation, hallucination mitigation, or RAG pipelines
Translate complex AI concepts (e.g., embeddings, prompting strategies, vector search, eval frameworks) into usable, testable product features
Strong technical background with a passion for breaking down challenging problems
Excellent analytical skills with demonstrated experience turning data into actionable insights
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills at the senior leadership level, as well as with cross-functional teams, especially ability to partner with engineering teams and explain technical terminology to non-technical audiences
Deep understanding of business strategy and metrics
Positive, people-oriented, and energetic attitude

Title: Assistant Store Manager, People & Community
RoleDescription:
External Posted Title: Assistant Store Manager, People & Community
Location: 1801 Howell Mill Rd NW, Atlanta, GA 30318
The base pay for this position is $90,000 - $100,000 per year. The base pay offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience.
Overview:
Wayfair is redefining the in-store experience for home shoppers, and were looking for a passionate Assistant Store Manager, People & Community to help shape the future of retail. In this role, youll lead all things related to training, team development, community engagement, and headcount planning. Youll be the go-to expert for onboarding, scheduling strategy, and compliance while also acting as the local marketing champion for the store. If youre energized by developing people, building connections, and making an impact in your community, this is your opportunity to lead from the heart of the action.
What Does an Assistant Store Manager, People & Community Do?

 Develop & Support the Team: Lead all onboarding and training initiatives to ensure team members are knowledgeable, engaged, and empowered to succeed.
 Drive Scheduling & Staffing Strategy: Own headcount planning and scheduling in alignment with store traffic and business needs.
 Ensure Compliance: Partner with leadership to audit training, track completion timelines, and uphold labor and policy standards.
 Partner Across Teams: Work closely with Store Enablement and leadership to roll out new training programs and elevate team performance.
 Lead Community & In-Store Events: Oversee in-store experiences and planned events in partnership with the Event Specialist.
 Own Grassroots Marketing: Leverage your knowledge of the Atlanta metro area to build partnerships, promote local events, and drive store traffic.
 Champion Culture: Be the connective tissue between people and processfostering an environment where every team member feels valued and every customer feels welcome.

Youll Thrive in this Role if You Have:

 Training & Development Know-How: Experience delivering training programs, onboarding new hires, and coaching team members.
 Operational & Scheduling Skills: Strong understanding of staffing strategies and workforce planning in dynamic retail environments.
 Local Community Ties: Youre well-connected in the Atlanta metro and passionate about building relationships that matter.
 Collaborative Leadership: You enjoy working cross-functionally and leading through influence, not just authority.
 Retail or Customer-Facing Experience: Background in retail, hospitality, or service industries is a plus.
 Flexible Availability: Ready to support store operations, including evenings, weekends, holidays, and special events.

Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:

 Physical Activity: Frequent standing, walking, and reaching with hands and arms; occasional sitting, climbing, and crawling.
 Mobility & Movement: Frequent stooping, kneeling, and crouching throughout the day.
 Lifting Ability: Must be able to lift and/or move up to 50 lbs regularly. Vision Requirements: Includes close, distance, color, and peripheral vision; depth perception and ability to adjust focus.
 Temperature Flexibility: Comfortable in environments with varying temperature conditions.
 Noise Tolerance: Occasional exposure to moderate noise levels and physical activity.
 Safety Awareness: Must adhere to all workplace safety protocols and procedures.

What are the Benefits?

 Competitive Pay: Earn competitive compensation with regular opportunities for performance-based increases and bonuses.
 Career Growth: Access professional development and advancement opportunities to grow with us.
 Health Benefits from Day One: Medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage starts on your first day.

Title: Product Manager - Payments
RoleDescription:
Candidates for this position are preferred to be based in Bengaluru, India and will be expected to comply with their team's hybrid work schedule requirements.
About the Role
At Wayfair, we believe everyone should live in a home they love  and were committed to making that possible through cutting-edge technology. The Buy Platform team owns the foundational systems that power payments at scale, ensuring every transaction is secure, reliable, and seamless.
We are seeking a Product Manager to help shape the future of Wayfairs payments platform. In this role, you will focus on improving core payments infrastructure  from authorization and routing to settlement and tokenization  working closely with Engineering, Data Science, and external vendors. Youll help ensure Wayfairs millions of global customers can transact with confidence while enabling scalable, efficient, and extensible systems that support billions of dollars in annual revenue.
What Youll Do

Own Payments Capabilities: Drive product strategy and execution for key payments platform features such as authorization flows, routing, and settlement services.
Support Vendor Integrations: Partner with global payment processors, fraud vendors, and other FinTech providers to deliver reliable, cost-effective integrations that enhance customer trust.
Collaborate Across Teams: Work with stakeholders in Payments, Financing, Loyalty, Fraud, Cart/Checkout, and Finance to align business objectives with platform priorities.
Enable Scalable Infrastructure: Partner with Engineering to design APIs and services that can handle high throughput and global scale, while ensuring resilience and extensibility.
Measure & Optimize: Define and track KPIs like authorization rates, decline reasons, and payment costs. Use data to drive continuous improvements in conversion and efficiency.
Ensure Compliance & Security: Collaborate with Legal, Risk, and Security teams to ensure that payments systems meet regulatory and compliance requirements globally.
Champion Reliability: Contribute to building systems with strong observability, redundancy, and failover strategies to minimize customer disruption.

What Youll Need

6+ years of overall experience and 3+ yrs into product management experience, ideally in payments, FinTech, or related e-commerce platform technology.
Understanding of core payments concepts such as authorization, routing, tokenization, chargebacks, and settlement.
Comfort engaging with engineering teams on architecture, APIs, and system design trade-offs  no coding required, but technical fluency is expected.
Strong product instincts and a platform-oriented mindset  youre motivated to build foundational capabilities that unlock downstream value.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with experience aligning business and technical teams.
Analytical skills to interpret payments data, identify trends, and prioritize improvements.
Experience with third-party vendor integrations in payments or fraud is a plus.
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or a related field  or equivalent practical experience.

"This position will be located in Atlanta, GA"

Overview:
At Wayfair, we create spaces where our customers and our teams can thrive. As a Facility Manager, youll be the cornerstone of a safe, well-maintained, and efficient retail environment. Youll lead with a service-first mindset, managing a high-performing team and third-party partners to ensure our facility runs smoothly, 24/7. From preventative maintenance and emergency response to vendor oversight and budget planning, your work will directly support a best-in-class shopping experience and a safe, inspiring place for our teams to work. If youre passionate about operational excellence, safety, and team development, this may be your professional home.
 
What Does a Facilities Manager Do?

 Lead with Safety & Purpose: View every action through a safety-first lens while creating a clean, secure environment for customers and associates.
 Manage & Mentor the Team: Train, schedule, and work alongside a team of 3+ facilities professionals while promoting a culture of safety, service, and accountability.
 Drive Preventative Maintenance: Oversee the execution of a comprehensive PM program with a 90%+ on-time completion rate minimizing downtime and keeping operations humming.
 Own Vendor Relationships: Manage third-party partners in key service areas including fire/life safety, vertical transportation, janitorial, pest control and more, ensuring performance and compliance.
 Use Data to Prioritize & Plan: Leverage Computerized Maintenance Management System (CMMS) and building management systems to analyze performance, prioritize tasks, and implement energy conservation strategies.
 Stay Ahead of the Schedule: Coordinate and communicate maintenance shutdowns, inspections, and compliance activities to minimize business disruption.
 Support Emergencies Proactively: Be available for off-hour response, lead root-cause analyses, and ensure transparent communication and documentation.
 Lead with Financial Acumen: Manage operational and capital budgets with a strategic eye toward maximizing ROI for the business.
 Ensure Regulatory Compliance: Maintain all building safety, environmental, and maintenance standards across local, state, and federal regulations.
 Understand Systems & Blueprints: Bring strong knowledge of mechanical, plumbing, electrical, and automation systems plus the ability to read and interpret architectural plans.


Youll Thrive in this Role if You Have:

 Facilities Expertise: 6+ years of facilities management experience, including vendor management, contract negotiation, and building operations oversight.
 Strong Financial Acumen: Confidence in managing departmental budgets and CapEx planning with strategic foresight.
 Leadership & Coaching Skills: A proven track record of building high-performing teams and mentoring team members for growth and accountability.
 Organizational Superpowers: Excellent project management, time management, and prioritization abilities to juggle multiple deadlines.
 Clear Communicator: Outstanding written and verbal communication skills for cross-functional and vendor collaboration.
 Analytical Thinker: A data-driven mindset that informs planning, problem-solving, and operational improvements.
 Tech-Forward Mindset: Familiarity with CMMS platforms (e.g., Maintenance Connection) and comfort using Google Suite and building automation systems.
 Retail Know-How (Strongly Preferred): Experience in large-format or big-box retail settings is a strong plus!
 Certifications (Strongly Preferred): Credentials from IFMA (CFM) or BOMA (FMC) are a bonus that elevates your application.

 
Additional Physical and Environmental Requirements:

 Physical Activity: Frequent standing, walking, and reaching with hands and arms; occasional sitting, climbing, balancing, and crawling.
 Mobility & Movement: Frequent stooping, kneeling, and crouching throughout the day.
 Lifting Ability: Ability to lift and move up to 50 lbs independently on a regular basis. Some projects may involve heavier items, which must be managed with proper assistance or equipment.
 Vision Requirements: Includes close, distance, color, and peripheral vision; depth perception and the ability to adjust focus.

Title: Data Scientist III, Customer Technology - Fintech & Loyalty
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $172,180 - $185,424 CAD per year. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Restricted stock units will be provided as part of the compensation package.
This is a hybrid role based out of our Toronto, Ontario office (Tuesday - Thursday Onsite, Monday / Friday remote)
Who We Are
Wayfair Data Science is the engine that powers an enterprise obsessed with data. The Customer Technology team builds and scales the platforms that enable Wayfair to deliver exceptional customer experiences across storefront, service, and financial products. Within this Customer technology organization, the Fintech & Loyalty team ensures customers have a seamless and rewarding journey by powering payments, financing, and loyalty programs.
The Fintech & Loyalty Data Science team aims to unlock & enable high quality product insights and develop innovative data products. We collaborate with Product, Engineering, Finance, Commercial and various external partners across diverse payments and financial products to improve and evolve our customers' purchase experiences. 
As a Data Scientist III for Customer Tech, your goal is to unlock insights and guide the business in the data domain. This includes everything from advising on technical implementation tradeoffs and priorities (e.g. funnel efficiencies, loyalty & card program growth etc.) to developing broad level strategic direction and vision in our customer data strategy and architecting the future data models to meet our users needs and anticipating impactful use cases. All while maintaining data quality and analytical rigor. To be successful, this role requires a blend of analytical experience, strong technical capability, ability to develop and influence business strategy, and stakeholder management; all applied to drive the quality, impactfulness, and vision of  Wayfairs customer data. 
What You'll Do

Define and own the strategic agenda to unlock insights and guide the business
Run open-ended exploratory data analysis to identify new ideas and opportunities
Champion the use of generative AI tools to accelerate analysis, automate repetitive tasks, and enhance insight generation.
Design and drive A/B tests of our latest technology being implemented ( e.g., new financing offers, rewards features, or personalized incentives) to ensure effective and accurate data capture for experimentation reporting
Own P&L reporting for Fintech & Loyalty programs, ensuring accurate tracking of financial performance and key metrics.
Proactively monitor our data to identify potential issues, determine root causes, and resolve. 
Build new tools and pipelines that allow us to be more productive and efficient.
Work closely and build productive relationships with our product, engineering,finance, commercial and machine learning stakeholders.
Proactively identify areas where advanced analytical efforts can produce a strong value add and work them into the road map.
Communicate key insights and recommendations to cross-functional executive leaders across the organization

What You'll Need

Bachelors in computer science, engineering, math, statistics, economics, or other quantitative discipline; Masters preferred.
4+ years work experience in a relevant field (in addition to any graduate education).
Analytics or Data Science experience with e-commerce or fintech companies is a strong plus.
In-depth experience with SQL (aggregate functions, query optimization, stored procedures, string parsing, GBQ/Spark, etc.), required.
In-depth experience with python & python tools (Jupyter notebooks, functions, pandas, sklearn, matplotlib, etc.), required.
Experience with experimental design (A/B tests) and statistical analysis to drive business decision making.
Experience with Looker (or similar BI tools) for reporting and dashboarding.
Knowledge and experience using machine learning algorithms/techniques (decision trees, random forest, deep learning, etc.) within a business context, highly preferred. 
Strong written and verbal communication with a team player, highly collaborative attitude. 
Ability to collaborate and proactively communicate with stakeholders.
Proven track record of taking ownership and driving results. Thrive in a fast-paced environment. 
Strong business acumen, analytical skills, and technical abilities along with problem-solving skills.
Demonstrated success influencing senior level stakeholders on strategic direction based on recommendations backed by in-depth analysis.
Prior experience proactively identifying areas where analytical efforts can produce a strong business value add and setting the analytics roadmap.
Able to manage multiple projects and deliver against aggressive goals.

Who We Are:
Wayfair believes everyone deserves a home they love, and that furnishing your home should be a source of fun, not anxiety. Our product team plays a crucial role in making this vision a reality for millions of people around the world. Partnering with engineering, UX design, analytics, and business partners across Wayfair, our product team ensures that were building technology that solves important customer problems in elegant, scalable, measurable ways. We have a modern tech stack including sophisticated capabilities around AI, data science, multivariate testing, and personalization. Were a highly collaborative, supportive team that values learning, psychological safety, and intentional career development.
We are seeking an innovative, entrepreneurial and technical product leader to join the Growth Customer Experience product team. This role is pivotal in shaping how we differentiate Wayfair with inspiration-first discovery experiences, engaging customers visiting from various marketing journeys and creating helpful home project-oriented experiences. You will have the opportunity to leverage cutting-edge AI and personalization technologies to craft a best-in-class user experience, guiding customers on a seamless journey from the moment they land on our site. This role requires a candidate with a comprehensive understanding of complex, cross-functional systems across multiple domains and a passion for creating data-driven, personalized experiences. You will not only oversee the implementation of the product roadmap, but define the long-term strategy for how we introduce customers to our site, ensuring a unique and tailored experience for every individual.
 What Youll Do:

Use data to understand customer needs and behaviors; map those against business objectives, and transform that knowledge into AI-powered product enhancements
Build client agnostic backends that solve for the needs of customers across all of our platforms: iOS and Android apps, mobile web and desktop applications
Given a broad and complex product strategy, independently own and craft a sequenced set of outcomes and solutions over a 12+ month time horizon
Build and maintain roadmaps for your product(s); partner with user experience design and usability, analytics, engineering, technical program managers, other product managers, and stakeholders to translate your vision and roadmap into reality

Title: Category Sales Solutions Manager
RoleDescription:
The salary range for this position is $67,230-$81,800/yr +target bonus of $20,000/yr. The base salary offered may vary depending on location, job -related knowledge, skills and experience.
The Category Ops Project Specialist is responsible for driving operational excellence across the full project lifecycle within their given category - from category opportunity vetting to end to end opportunity management. This involves managed sales and B2B category stakeholder management coordination, customer and post-order communication, as well as order execution. This role acts as the central Account Management and Enterprise large project category owner - ensuring seamless handoffs, project deliverable alignment, resolving roadblocks, and facilitating clear communication to achieve successful project outcomes. In addition to project management, the category specialists will execute against sales capabilities and order placement, as the subject matter experts of the category. 
Key Responsibilities:

Opportunity Vetting

Gather key deliverable, product, and logistics details - including project scope, timelines, and delivery requirements.
Determine feasibility and next steps for customer engagement. 
Request additional insight and specs on the category project directly with the customer, providing visibility to the managed sales partner engagement.

End to End Opportunity Management & Project Prioritization

Partner with managed field sales teams to communicate with customers on project needs and budget, ensuring inclusion in the opportunity submission. 
Evaluate and prioritize projects based on potential value, partner lead times on deliverables, and customer deadline for completion.
Maintain visibility into the project pipeline to support proactive planning.
Align internal stakeholders and resources for execution, driving a timeline for completion forward.

Stakeholder & Customer Communication Strategy

Coordinate across relevant PSG team members to ensure smooth workflows and completion of the project in a timely manner. 
Act as the communication bridge between managed sales teams and Large Project team members to be the single source of truth for project needs.
Track and document opportunity timeline and needs to reduce friction and improve efficiency.
Drive key supplier negotiations and issue resolution by effectively partnering with sales ops on execution.
Coordinate with B2B category management stakeholders to ensure close alignment on category pricing strategy, product selection, and inventory positioning. 

Project Roadblock Escalation & Resolution

Identify and address risks or delays across the project lifecycle.
Escalate issues to relevant stakeholders and proactively provide recommended solutions to managed sales teams. 
Drive accountability and follow-up on open items until resolution, prior to order placement to project installation.

Order Execution & Procurement

Source and procure products for a category project, ensuring availability, quality, and alignment with project needs.
Place and track category-specific orders accurately and on time to support the project timeline.
Own category relevant project quoting, including bulk requests and tag items per room location. 
Manage SKU reselects and substitute out-of-stock items efficiently to avoid project delays and maintain the initial order integrity.

Post-Order Project Completion

Maintain visibility into final delivery, installation, and possible project delays - coordinating with the customer on their timing and managing the customers specific needs.  
Coordinate post-order support between the Service and the Large Project delivery/installation team, effectively facilitating next steps to complete the project.
